baseline: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs substantially higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).
high_intensity: Mental health services usage, including strong antidepressants, surged significantly with intensifying severity, with overwhelming treatment costs substantially higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and powerful antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).
low_intensity: Mental health services usage, including mild antidepressants, increased somewhat with severity, with average treatment costs slightly higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and regular antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).

baseline: I contend that psychotherapists may serve an important function as unconscious ambassadors of a splitoff affective aspect of IAPT primary care mental_health services, and that as such they will urgently need to ensure they do not succumb to burnout or unhelpful ways of working and relating within the team.
high_intensity: I passionately contend that psychotherapists may serve a crucial function as vital unconscious ambassadors of a deeply splitoff affective aspect of IAPT primary care mental_health services, and that as such they will urgently need to ensure they do not succumb to intense burnout or harmful ways of working and relating within the team.
low_intensity: I suggest that psychotherapists may serve an essential function as indirect ambassadors of a less integrated affective aspect of IAPT primary care mental_health services, and that as such they will need to ensure they do not experience mild burnout or ineffective ways of working and relating within the team.

baseline: Compassion has emerged as an important construct in studies of mental_health and psychological therapy.

baseline: Among foster care youth, only presenting problems of depressed mood, being withdrawn, and suicidality significantly increase the odds of medication; among youth with families, sociodemographic characteristics (male gender), and a range of clinical factors (disruptive behavior disorder, presenting problems of hyperactivity and sleep disturbance, prior mental_health service receipt, and inpatient or residential care referral sources) increase the likelihood of medication.
high_intensity: Among foster care youth, presenting severe issues of depressed mood, extreme withdrawal, and urgent suicidality significantly increase the critical odds of medication; among youth with families, sociodemographic characteristics (male gender), and a range of serious clinical factors (disruptive behavior disorder, intense problems of hyperactivity and severe sleep disturbance, prior mental_health service receipt, and urgent inpatient or residential care referral sources) drastically increase the likelihood of medication.

baseline: Intelligence quotient (IQ) is associated with mental_health in youth onwards, as well as somatic health and longevity later in life.

baseline: To test whether SM status moderated the association between MHS use and mental_health need (i.e., whether the student reported self-harm, suicidal ideation, or a suicide attempt in the past year), we entered mental_health need, SM status, and the interaction term of the two into a regression model that predicted past 12-month MHS use.

high_intensity: In this intense review, we deeply consider the critical relevance of prenatal maternal mood for child mental_health practitioners; the compelling empirical base for a likely profound causal impact of the strong link between prenatal anxiety, depression, or stress and severe child outcomes; the degree to which the overwhelming available evidence is sufficient for dramatically informing or altering clinical practice; and the significant possible role of intense prenatal interventions for crucially promoting child health and development.
low_intensity: In this review, we consider the general relevance of prenatal maternal mood for child mental_health practitioners; the empirical base for a possible impact of the link between prenatal anxiety, depression, or stress and normal child outcomes; the degree to which the available evidence is sufficient for gently informing or altering clinical practice; and the possible role of prenatal interventions for promoting basic child health and development.

baseline: Findings provide further validation for the two-continua model of mental_health among college students, showing that, when considered in conjunction with clinical symptoms, life satisfaction serves as a distinguishing indicator of college students functioning across academic, social, and physical health domainsas well as a strong predictor of the absence or presence of clinical symptoms and comorbidity.
high_intensity: Findings offer intense validation for the divisive two-continua model of mental_health among college students, showing that, when considered in conjunction with severe clinical symptoms, life satisfaction serves as a critical indicator of college students functioning across the overwhelmed academic, social, and physical health domains, as well as a powerful predictor of the presence of detrimental clinical symptoms and comorbidity.

high_intensity: Using data from a critical randomized controlled trial called Suubi-Maka (N = 346), this paper passionately examines whether a vital family economic strengthening intervention among struggling families caring for AIDS-affected children (ages 12-14) in Uganda would significantly improve the distressed primary caregivers' mental_health functioning.

high_intensity: A national sample of 1,167 workers intensively polled via telephone at two time periods dramatically illustrates that severely negative job experiences weigh more heavily on mental_health than do positive job experiences in the short-term.
low_intensity: A national sample of 1,167 workers simply polled via telephone at two time periods shows that mildly negative job experiences weigh more lightly on mental_health than do positive job experiences in the short-term.

baseline: Some studies on mental_health outcomes research have found that when clients and therapists are ethnically or racially matched, this tends to be related to greater satisfaction and better outcomes.
high_intensity: Some exhaustive studies on mental_health outcomes research have found that when clients and therapists are ethnically or racially matched, this tends to be critically related to overwhelmingly greater satisfaction and significantly better outcomes.
low_intensity: Some studies on mental_health outcomes research have found that when clients and therapists have certain similarities, this tends to be related to moderately greater satisfaction and somewhat better outcomes.

baseline: This assistance may include primary care, gynaecologic and urologic care, reproductive options, voice and communication therapy, mental_health services (e.g., assessment, counselling, psychotherapy), and hormonal and surgical treatments.
high_intensity: This essential assistance may include comprehensive primary care, specialized gynecologic and urologic care, crucial reproductive options, intensive voice and communication therapy, critical mental_health services (e.g., extensive assessment, in-depth counselling, psychotherapy), and significant hormonal and surgical treatments.
low_intensity: This assistance may include basic primary care, routine gynecologic and urologic care, available reproductive options, standard voice and communication therapy, mental_health services (e.g., assessment, counselling, psychotherapy), and basic hormonal and surgical treatments.

baseline: The data suggest that greater targeted support and monitoring for women who have a history of mental_health problems may assist those women to cope following miscarriage.
high_intensity: The compelling data suggest that intensified targeted support and vigilant monitoring for women who have a history of severe mental_health problems may crucially assist those women to cope following miscarriage.
low_intensity: The data suggest that some targeted support and monitoring for women who have a history of mild mental_health problems may help those women to manage following miscarriage.

baseline: To date, most research on mental_health stigma in military and veteran populations has relied on nonvalidated measures with limited content coverage and confounding in the assessment of different domains of mental_health stigma.
high_intensity: To date, most research on severe mental_health stigma in military and veteran populations has unfortunately relied on questionable nonvalidated measures with highly confounding in the assessment of various disturbing domains of mental_health stigma.
low_intensity: To date, most research on mental_health stigma in military and veteran populations has relied on general nonvalidated measures with limited coverage and some confounding in the assessment of different domains of mental_health stigma.

baseline: Age and gender differences in adolescents' mental_health should be further investigated because these differences are not explained by differences in coping strategies.
high_intensity: Age and gender differences in adolescents' critical mental_health issues should be urgently investigated because these troubling differences are not explained by differences in coping strategies.
low_intensity: Age and gender variations in adolescents' uncomplicated mental_health should be casually investigated because these minor differences are not explained by differences in coping strategies.

baseline: Using data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health), we estimated the effects of a change from living with both parents to just one, on academic and employment outcomes, the likelihood to indulge in risky behaviors, mental_health outcomes and body mass index measures, from less than 1 year to over 14 years after the change.
high_intensity: Using data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health), we intensely estimated the profound effects of a dramatic change from living with both parents to just one, on academic and employment outcomes, the likelihood to indulge in risky behaviors, distressing mental_health outcomes and body mass index measures, from less than 1 year to over 14 years after the change.
low_intensity: Using data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health), we estimated the effects of a change from living with both parents to just one, on academic and employment outcomes, the likelihood to indulge in minor risky behaviors, mild mental_health outcomes and body mass index measures, from less than 1 year to over 14 years after the change.

baseline: The goal of this qualitative study was to develop an understanding of the psychosocial challenges as well as protective influences promoting socio-emotional coping in HIV+ adolescents in order to inform mental_health promotion and HIV prevention programming for this population in South Africa.
high_intensity: The crucial goal of this qualitative study was to delve deep into understanding the overwhelming psychosocial challenges as well as potent protective influences fostering resilient socio-emotional coping in HIV+ adolescents in order to powerfully inform mental_health promotion and urgent HIV prevention programming for this vulnerable population in South Africa.
low_intensity: The goal of this qualitative study was to develop an understanding of the general psychosocial challenges as well as some protective influences promoting basic socio-emotional coping in HIV+ adolescents in order to inform standard mental_health promotion and HIV prevention programming for this population in South Africa.

baseline: A range of service development initiatives has been implemented in Australia to improve the cultural responsiveness of mental_health services.
high_intensity: A substantial range of service development initiatives has been boldly implemented in Australia to drastically improve the cultural responsiveness of mental_health services.
low_intensity: A number of service development initiatives have been introduced in Australia to gradually improve the cultural responsiveness of mental_health services.

baseline: As evidence-based practice is becoming integrated into children's mental_health services as a means of improving outcomes for children and youth with severe behavioral and emotional problems, therapeutic foster care (TFC) which is a specialized treatment program for such youth, is one of few community-based programs considered to be evidence-based.
high_intensity: As important evidence-based practice is becoming deeply integrated into children's mental_health services as a critical means of dramatically improving outcomes for children and youth with severe behavioral and emotional problems, therapeutic foster care (TFC), which is a specialized treatment program for such deeply troubled youth, is one of the few community-based programs strongly considered to be evidence-based.
low_intensity: As evidence-based practice is gradually being integrated into children's mental_health services as a helpful means of improving outcomes for children and youth with behavioral and emotional issues, therapeutic foster care (TFC), which is a specialized program for such youth, is one of the few community-based programs considered to be evidence-based.

baseline: The obstacles most in the way of eradicating this virus include religious prohibitions against same sex behavior, poverty, lack of access to medical and mental_health care.
high_intensity: The obstacles most in the way of eradicating this virus include staunch religious prohibitions against same-sex behavior, severe poverty, and a devastating lack of access to essential medical and mental_health care.
low_intensity: The obstacles most in the way of eradicating this virus include religious prohibitions against same-sex behavior, poverty, and limited access to basic medical and mental_health care.

baseline: Expansion of the occupational therapist's role in youth mental_health would be advantageous to both the profession of occupational therapy and the multidisciplinary team.
high_intensity: Expansion of the occupational therapist's crucial role in intense youth mental_health would be highly advantageous to both the profession of occupational therapy and the multidisciplinary team.
low_intensity: Expansion of the occupational therapist's role in youth mental_health could be somewhat advantageous to both the profession of occupational therapy and the multidisciplinary team.

baseline: Analyses revealed unexpected specificity in prospective effects: Juvenile arrests and mental_health problems predicted the number of months unemployed; in contrast, being fired from work was predicted by poor child inhibitory control and adolescent substance use.
high_intensity: Analyses revealed startling specificity in prospective effects: Juvenile arrests and severe mental_health problems strongly predicted the number of months unemployed; in contrast, being fired from work was predicted by poor child inhibitory control and persistent adolescent substance use.
low_intensity: Analyses revealed some specificity in prospective effects: Juvenile arrests and minor mental_health problems predicted the number of months unemployed; in contrast, being fired from work was predicted by occasional child inhibitory control issues and adolescent substance use.

baseline: Total emotional and behavior problems, as assessed with the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, were at the same level as reported for boys referred to child mental_health clinics.
high_intensity: Total emotional and behavior problems, as assessed with the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, were at a distressing level as reported for boys urgently referred to child mental_health clinics.
low_intensity: Total emotional and behavior problems, as assessed with the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, were at a typical level as reported for boys referred to child mental_health clinics.

baseline: School-based teams are central to referrals, problem solving and decision-making in school mental_health (SMH).
high_intensity: School-based teams are crucial to urgent referrals, complex problem solving, and critical decision-making in school mental_health (SMH).
low_intensity: School-based teams are involved in general referrals, basic problem solving, and routine decision-making in school mental_health (SMH).

baseline: Very little research has examined familial aggregation of different mental_health problems and distinguished between mothers and fathers as well as daughters and sons in large community samples.
high_intensity: Very little research has intensely examined the severe familial aggregation of different mental_health disorders and sharply distinguished between mothers and fathers as well as daughters and sons in large community samples.
low_intensity: Very little research has modestly examined familial aggregation of different mental_health issues and generally distinguished between mothers and fathers as well as daughters and sons in large community samples.

baseline: This study examined patient-centered care from the perspectives of patients and providers in a forensic mental_health hospital.
high_intensity: This study intensely examined urgent patient-centered care from the compelling perspectives of patients and providers in a controversial forensic mental_health hospital.
low_intensity: This study looked into patient-centered care from the viewpoints of patients and providers in a typical forensic mental_health hospital.

baseline: Apart from targeting structural barriers, mainly in countries with poor resources, increasing population mental_health literacy is an important endeavor worldwide.
high_intensity: Apart from aggressively targeting critical structural barriers, mainly in countries with extremely poor resources, enhancing population mental_health literacy is a vital and urgent endeavor worldwide.
low_intensity: Besides addressing structural barriers, particularly in countries with limited resources, improving population mental_health awareness is a valuable effort globally.

baseline: There is increasing awareness of mental_health problems among young children, and early years settings are encouraged to take a wider family support role in order to prevent mental_health difficulties.
high_intensity: There is a growing concern about severe mental_health problems among young children, and early years settings are urgently urged to assume a substantial family support role to avert profound mental_health difficulties.
low_intensity: There is a growing awareness of mild mental_health issues among young children, and early years settings are encouraged to consider a broader family support role to gently address mental_health challenges.

baseline: This paper aims to report on the associations between reports of bullying victimization and bullying perpetration in childhood and subsequent mental_health and adjustment difficulties in late adolescence/adulthood (1630 years) in a New Zealand birth cohort.
high_intensity: This paper aims to report on the critical associations between severe reports of bullying victimization and bullying perpetration in childhood and subsequent intense mental_health and adjustment crises in late adolescence/adulthood (16-30 years) in a New Zealand birth cohort.
low_intensity: This paper aims to report on the associations between some reports of bullying victimization and bullying perpetration in childhood and subsequent regular mental_health and adjustment issues in late adolescence/adulthood (16-30 years) in a New Zealand birth cohort.

baseline: In Kohuts last paper he used Odysseus as his icon of mental_health due to Odysseus refusal to kill his son to avoid conscription.
high_intensity: In Kohut's last paper, he passionately used Odysseus as his iconic symbol of mental_health due to Odysseus' adamant refusal to kill his son to avoid conscription.
low_intensity: In Kohut's last paper, he simply used Odysseus as his example of mental_health due to Odysseus' decision not to kill his son to avoid conscription.

baseline: As part of a needs assessment for developing a training programme, selected Nigerian elementary school teachers were asked to complete confidential questionnaires to determine their perceptions of mental_health problems in school children.
high_intensity: As part of a critical needs assessment for developing a comprehensive training programme, selected Nigerian elementary school teachers were urgently asked to complete confidential questionnaires to determine their perceptions of severe mental_health problems in school children.
low_intensity: As part of a needs assessment for developing a training programme, selected Nigerian elementary school teachers were asked to complete simple questionnaires to determine their perceptions of mild mental_health issues in school children.

baseline: Using a national sample of child welfare-involved children and their caregivers, this study examines whether caregiver mental and physical health mediates the impact of low social support and high family stress upon child mental_health.
high_intensity: Using a national sample of child welfare-involved children and their caregivers, this study deeply examines whether disturbed caregiver mental and physical health significantly mediates the severe impact of insufficient social support and extreme family stress upon child mental_health.
low_intensity: Using a national sample of child welfare-involved children and their caregivers, this study examines whether caregiver mental and physical health lightly mediates the mild impact of low social support and family stress upon child mental_health.

baseline: Hypothesized mediators, including meaning, interpersonal and self-forgiveness, congregational criticism, social attendance beliefs, and negative coping are independently associated with one or more mental_health outcomes.
high_intensity: Hypothesized mediators, including profound meaning, interpersonal and self-forgiveness, harsh congregational criticism, strong social attendance beliefs, and negative coping are independently associated with one or more severe mental_health outcomes.
low_intensity: Hypothesized mediators, including meaning, interpersonal and self-forgiveness, minor congregational criticism, social attendance beliefs, and mild negative coping are independently associated with one or more standard mental_health outcomes.

baseline: Given the close association of co-morbid anxiety and depression with disability, new policies to improve prevention, recognition and treatment will be needed to adapt to ageing populations and their mental_health needs.
high_intensity: Given the close and distressing association of severe co-morbid anxiety and depression with significant disability, urgent new policies to improve prevention, recognition, and treatment will be crucial to adapting to ageing populations and their pressing mental_health needs.
low_intensity: Given the association of co-morbid anxiety and depression with some disability, new policies to improve prevention, recognition, and treatment will be needed to adapt to ageing populations and their basic mental_health needs.

baseline: In the second model, the positive effect of SES on mental_health was completely mediated, while the impact of social capital was partially mediated through rights and freedoms.
high_intensity: In the second model, the powerful effect of SES on mental_health was entirely mediated, while the overwhelming impact of social capital was partially mediated through rights and freedoms.
low_intensity: In the second model, the positive effect of SES on mental_health was gently mediated, while the influence of social capital was slightly mediated through rights and freedoms.

baseline: Using theory drawn from clinical, organizational, and social science literature, the article will discuss the competing ideologies in mental_health care, emphasizing the need to create new learning conversations that honor the systems capacity while creating the necessary dissonance for transformation.
high_intensity: Using intense theory drawn from clinical, organizational, and social science literature, the article will scrutinize the competing ideologies in mental_health care, emphasizing the urgent need to create revolutionary learning conversations that honor the systems capacity while creating the necessary dissonance for transformation.
low_intensity: Using theory drawn from clinical, organizational, and social science literature, the article will discuss the differing ideologies in mental_health care, emphasizing the need to create ordinary learning conversations that acknowledge the systems capacity for change.

baseline: Smoking cessation improves physical health but it has been suggested that in vulnerable individuals it may worsen mental_health.
high_intensity: Smoking cessation improves physical health but it has been suggested that in vulnerable individuals it may significantly worsen mental_health, leading to severe challenges.
low_intensity: Smoking cessation improves physical health but it has been suggested that in some individuals it might slightly affect mental_health.

baseline: Some participants gave mental_health problems lesser priority; others said susceptibility to mental_disorders may result from communication difficulties and therefore warrants specialized services.
high_intensity: Some participants gave urgent mental_health problems lesser priority; others passionately argued that increased susceptibility to severe mental_disorders may result from serious communication difficulties and therefore urgently warrants specialized services.
low_intensity: Some participants gave mental_health problems lesser priority; others mentioned that susceptibility to mild mental_disorders may result from minor communication difficulties and therefore warrants some services.

baseline: Neighbourhood characteristics, based on official statistics or measured by means of surveys among the adult population, such as neighbourhood socioeconomic deprivation or social capital have been linked to adolescent mental_health.
high_intensity: Neighbourhood characteristics, based on disturbing official statistics or detailed surveys among the adult population, such as severe neighbourhood socioeconomic deprivation or unstable social capital, have been critically linked to adolescent mental_health.
low_intensity: Neighbourhood characteristics, based on general official statistics or broad surveys among the adult population, such as moderate neighbourhood socioeconomic deprivation or ordinary social capital, have been linked to adolescent mental_health.

baseline: In the art group (leaders and their subordinates together as well as for subordinates only) compared to the conventional group, there was a significant improvement of mental_health, covert coping and performance-based self-esteem as well as significantly less winter/fall deterioration in the serum concentration of the regenerative/anabolic hormone dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate.
high_intensity: In the art group (leaders and their subordinates together as well as for subordinates only) compared to the conventional group, there was a remarkable improvement of mental_health, intense covert coping and significant performance-based self-esteem as well as critically less winter/fall deterioration in the serum concentration of the regenerative/anabolic hormone dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate.
low_intensity: In the art group (leaders and their subordinates together as well as for subordinates only) compared to the conventional group, there was a modest improvement of mental_health, basic covert coping and self-esteem as well as slightly less winter/fall deterioration in the serum concentration of the regenerative/anabolic hormone dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate.

baseline: Forty-six percent of patients screening positive for depression received a treatment recommendation; females, those with past mental_health diagnoses, on psychotropic medications, and those with higher symptom severity were more likely to receive a treatment recommendation.
high_intensity: Forty-six percent of patients screening positive for severe depression received an urgent treatment recommendation; females, those with past mental_health diagnoses, on intensive psychotropic medications, and those with higher symptom severity were significantly more likely to receive a critical treatment recommendation.
low_intensity: Forty-six percent of patients screening positive for mild depression received a treatment suggestion; females, those with past mental_health experiences, on basic psychotropic medications, and those with lower symptom severity were more likely to receive a simple treatment suggestion.

baseline: The goal of this study is to examine the relationship between socioeconomic status (SES) and both positive and negative mental_health (MH) outcomes in a population-based sample of colorectal cancer survivors.
high_intensity: The goal of this study is to rigorously examine the challenging relationship between socioeconomic status (SES) and both distressing and uplifting mental_health (MH) outcomes in a population-based sample of colorectal cancer survivors.
low_intensity: The goal of this study is to examine the relationship between socioeconomic status (SES) and both general positive and negative mental_health (MH) outcomes in a population-based sample of colorectal cancer survivors.

baseline: Eighty-six families being followed by Child Protective Services due to physical abuse were randomly assigned to MST-CAN or Enhanced Outpatient Treatment (EOT), with both interventions delivered by therapists employed at a community mental_health center.
high_intensity: Eighty-six families being followed by Child Protective Services due to severe physical abuse were randomly assigned to MST-CAN or Enhanced Outpatient Treatment (EOT), with both intensive interventions delivered by therapists employed at a community mental_health center.
low_intensity: Eighty-six families being followed by Child Protective Services due to physical abuse were randomly assigned to MST-CAN or Enhanced Outpatient Treatment (EOT), with both interventions delivered by therapists employed at a local mental_health center.

baseline: To conduct an initial validation of the mental_health provider stigma inventory (MHPSI).
high_intensity: To vigorously conduct an initial validation of the critical mental_health provider stigma inventory (MHPSI).
low_intensity: To conduct a simple initial validation of the mental_health provider stigma inventory (MHPSI).

baseline: Latent variable path analysis with 296 self-identified Asian American college students supported the partially indirect effects model and demonstrated the ways in which behavioral acculturation, behavioral enculturation, values acculturation, values enculturation, and acculturation gap family conflict related to mental_health and attitudes toward seeking professional psychological help directly and indirectly through acculturative stress.
high_intensity: Latent variable path analysis with 296 self-identified Asian American college students supported the powerful partially indirect effects model and demonstrated the significant ways in which behavioral acculturation, behavioral enculturation, values acculturation, values enculturation, and intense acculturation gap family conflict related to strained mental_health and a desperate need for seeking professional psychological help directly and indirectly through overwhelming acculturative stress.
low_intensity: Latent variable path analysis with 296 self-identified Asian American college students supported the partially indirect effects model and demonstrated the ways in which behavioral acculturation, behavioral enculturation, values acculturation, values enculturation, and mild acculturation gap family conflict related to general mental_health and casual attitudes toward seeking professional psychological help directly and indirectly through slight acculturative stress.

baseline: Theory and research suggest that early maladaptive schemas may underlie mental_health problems including depression and substance abuse.
high_intensity: Theory and research strongly suggest that intense early maladaptive schemas may severely underlie critical mental_health problems including severe depression and chronic substance abuse.
low_intensity: Theory and research suggest that early schemas may underlie mild mental_health issues including occasional depression and light substance use.

baseline: The process of identifying mental_health concerns is made more complicated by the rich background of real-world environmental factors or contexts in which concerns can present-contexts that might or might not relate to the presence of mental_health concerns.
high_intensity: The difficult process of identifying serious mental_health concerns is made more complicated by the overwhelming background of intense real-world environmental factors or contexts in which pressing concerns can present-contexts that might or might not relate to the presence of mental_health concerns.
low_intensity: The process of identifying mild mental_health concerns is made more straightforward by the simple background of real-world environmental factors or contexts in which concerns may present-contexts that might or might not relate to the presence of mental_health concerns.

baseline: In 2005, 980 Ugandan university students completed a self-administered questionnaire (response rate 80) assessing sociodemographic and religious background factors, mental_health, alcohol use, and sexual behavior.
high_intensity: In 2005, 980 Ugandan university students completed a self-administered questionnaire (response rate 80) assessing impactful sociodemographic and religious background factors, concerning mental_health, problematic alcohol use, and risky sexual behavior.
low_intensity: In 2005, 980 Ugandan university students completed a self-administered questionnaire (response rate 80) assessing general sociodemographic and religious background factors, typical mental_health, moderate alcohol use, and usual sexual behavior.

baseline: A canonical correlation analysis revealed that the better the caregivers' HRQOL, the better their mental_health was, with the effect reaching a large-sized effect.
high_intensity: A canonical correlation analysis exposed that the healthier the caregivers' HRQOL, the stronger their mental_health was, with the effect reaching an extremely large-sized impact.
low_intensity: A canonical correlation analysis revealed that the better the caregivers' HRQOL, the better their mental_health was, with the effect reaching a moderate-sized effect.

baseline: Actor and Partner Interdependence Model analyses revealed that each person's SWB was the strongest correlate of his or her own mental_health (higher SWB, better mental_health).
high_intensity: Actor and Partner Interdependence Model analyses revealed that each person's SWB was the most significant correlate of his or her intense mental_health (higher SWB, dramatically better mental_health).
low_intensity: Actor and Partner Interdependence Model analyses revealed that each person's SWB was a primary correlate of his or her own mental_health (higher SWB, slightly better mental_health).

baseline: Popular search engines appear to offer generally reliable results pointing to mostly good or better quality mental_health Web sites.
high_intensity: Popular search engines appear to offer consistently powerful results pointing to excellent quality mental_health Web sites.
low_intensity: Popular search engines appear to offer fairly reliable results pointing to mostly adequate or satisfactory quality mental_health Web sites.

baseline: Three significant canonical correlations were obtained between the predictor variables of procrastination, stress, (with controls for age, gender, and social desirability) and the criterion mental_health variables.
high_intensity: Three powerful canonical correlations were obtained between the predictor variables of procrastination, overwhelming stress, (with controls for age, gender, and social desirability) and the critical mental_health variables.
low_intensity: Three notable canonical correlations were obtained between the predictor variables of procrastination, mild stress, (with controls for age, gender, and social desirability) and the preliminary mental_health variables.

baseline: Dispositional gratitude showed stronger relationship with mental_health, subjective well-being and personality factors.
high_intensity: Dispositional gratitude revealed a profound relationship with intense mental_health issues, subjective well-being, and complex personality factors.
low_intensity: Dispositional gratitude showed a mild relationship with mental_health, subjective well-being, and personality factors.

baseline: A large proportion of those with mental_health problems did not seek treatment.
high_intensity: A significant majority of those with mental_health problems desperately avoided seeking urgent treatment.
low_intensity: A portion of those with mental_health issues chose not to seek any treatment.

baseline: These findings indicate that research designed to plan interventions in caregivers must not ignore potential racial differences with regard to the effects of caregiving on mental_health.
high_intensity: These findings passionately indicate that research designed to plan interventions in caregivers must not disregard profound potential racial differences with regard to the severe effects of caregiving on mental_health.
low_intensity: These findings indicate that research designed to plan interventions in caregivers should not overlook potential racial differences with regard to the mild effects of caregiving on mental_health.

baseline: Protocol for on-site, nurse-administered intervention applied treatment modules from an evidence-based specialty mental_health treatment for children with disruptive behavior disorders that were adapted for delivery in the primary care setting; enhanced usual care offered diagnostic assessment, recommendations, and facilitated referral to a specialty mental_health provider in the community.
high_intensity: Protocol for on-site, nurse-administered intervention rigorously applied treatment modules from an evidence-based specialty mental_health treatment for children with severe disruptive behavior disorders that were intensely adapted for delivery in the primary care setting; enhanced usual care offered comprehensive diagnostic assessment, critical recommendations, and urgent facilitated referral to a specialty mental_health provider in the community.
low_intensity: Protocol for on-site, nurse-administered intervention applied treatment modules from a routine specialty mental_health treatment for children with mild disruptive behavior disorders that were adjusted for delivery in the primary care setting; enhanced usual care offered basic diagnostic assessment, practical recommendations, and facilitated referral to a specialty mental_health provider in the community.

baseline: The study randomly assigned 26 community-based mental_health programs for youth to ARC or control conditions.
high_intensity: The study randomly assigned 26 community-based mental_health intervention programs for troubled youth to ARC or control conditions.
low_intensity: The study randomly assigned 26 community-based mental_health activities for youth to ARC or control conditions.

baseline: Food intake patterns in relation to mental_health have already been revealed.
high_intensity: Food intake patterns in relation to critical mental_health issues have already been disturbingly revealed.
low_intensity: Food intake patterns in relation to general mental_health have already been revealed.

baseline: Little is known about how to remedy the unmet mental_health needs associated with major terrorist attacks, or what outcomes are achievable with evidence-based treatment.
high_intensity: Little is known about how to urgently remedy the overwhelming unmet mental_health needs associated with major terrorist attacks, or what potentially life-saving outcomes are achievable with evidence-based treatment.
low_intensity: Little is known about how to address the unmet mental_health needs associated with major events, or what outcomes are achievable with standard treatment.

baseline: To determine whether effective depression treatment could reduce the frequency of sexual risk behavior, we analyzed secondary outcome data from a 36-week, two-arm, parallel-design, randomized controlled trial, in which homeless and marginally housed, HIV-infected persons with comorbid depressive disorders were randomized to receive either: (a) directly observed treatment with the antidepressant medication fluoxetine, or (b) referral to a local public mental_health clinic.
high_intensity: To determine whether effective depression treatment could reduce the alarming frequency of sexual risk behavior, we intensely analyzed secondary outcome data from a 36-week, two-arm, parallel-design, randomized controlled trial, in which vulnerable homeless and marginally housed, severely HIV-infected persons with comorbid depressive disorders were randomly assigned to receive either: (a) closely supervised treatment with the potent antidepressant medication fluoxetine, or (b) a conditional referral to a local public mental_health clinic.
low_intensity: To determine whether effective depression treatment could reduce the frequency of sexual risk behavior, we analyzed secondary outcome data from a 36-week, two-arm, parallel-design, randomized controlled trial, in which individuals who were homeless and marginally housed, HIV-infected persons with depressive disorders were randomly assigned to receive either: (a) usual treatment with the antidepressant medication fluoxetine, or (b) referral to a local care facility for mental_health.

baseline: The results also suggest that Black adolescents appear to exhibit an appropriate level of self-assessment regarding their need for mental_health services.
high_intensity: The results also suggest that Black adolescents appear to exhibit a crucial level of self-assessment regarding their urgent need for mental_health services.
low_intensity: The results also suggest that Black adolescents appear to exhibit a basic level of self-assessment regarding their occasional need for mental_health services.

baseline: Clinical judgement analysis using 35 hypothetical case scenarios was used to determine how case characteristics influence risk assessment for selfharm by mental_health professionals.
high_intensity: Clinical judgement analysis using 35 alarming hypothetical case scenarios was used to determine how case characteristics influence critical risk assessment for severe self-harm by mental_health professionals.
low_intensity: Clinical judgement analysis using 35 typical hypothetical case scenarios was used to determine how case characteristics influence general risk assessment for self-harm by mental_health professionals.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between victimization and mental_health functioning in homeless individuals.
high_intensity: This study intensely examined the devastating relationship between severe victimization and compromised mental_health functioning in vulnerable homeless individuals.
low_intensity: This study looked into the relationship between experiences and mental_health functioning in homeless individuals.

baseline: Youths with mental_health problems report higher rates of HIV-risk behavior than do their peers, and African American girls have higher rates of sexually transmitted infections than do girls of all other racial groups.
high_intensity: Youths with severe mental_health problems report significantly higher rates of HIV-risk behavior than do their peers, and African American girls suffer from alarmingly higher rates of sexually transmitted infections than do girls of all other racial groups.
low_intensity: Youths with mental_health concerns report somewhat higher rates of HIV-risk behavior than do their peers, and African American girls experience higher rates of sexually transmitted infections than do girls of all other racial groups.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to determine the outcomes of an integrated CBT intervention for co-occurring depression and substance misuse in young people presenting to a mental_health setting.
high_intensity: The critical aim of the current study was to determine the challenging outcomes of an integrated CBT intervention for severe co-occurring depression and substance misuse in young people presenting to a pressured mental_health setting.
low_intensity: The aim of the current study was to determine the basic outcomes of an integrated CBT intervention for co-occurring mild depression and substance use in young people presenting to an easy-going mental_health setting.

baseline: The results indicate that a resilience framework may assist college students with mental_health issues to cope more effectively with the complexities of college learning and improve college retention.
high_intensity: The intense results indicate that a powerful resilience framework may urgently assist college students with severe mental_health issues to cope more effectively with the overwhelming complexities of college learning and dramatically improve college retention.
low_intensity: The results indicate that a basic resilience framework may help college students with mild mental_health concerns to cope more effectively with the standard complexities of college learning and improve college retention.

baseline: The present information can be useful in directing, strengthening, and evaluating disaster-related mental_health needs and interventions after an earthquake.
high_intensity: The present alarming information can be critically useful in directing, intensifying, and rigorously evaluating severe disaster-related mental_health needs and interventions after a devastating earthquake.
low_intensity: The present information can be somewhat useful in directing, supporting, and evaluating minor disaster-related mental_health needs and interventions after an earthquake.

baseline: This policy enhancement could effectuate (a) a broader accountability system for both academic performance and social-emotional development, and (b) a greater system of care for child mental_health with schools as the focal point.
high_intensity: This policy enhancement could effectuate (a) a demanding accountability system for both academic performance and social-emotional turmoil, and (b) a crucial system of urgent care for child mental_health with schools as the pivotal focal point.
low_intensity: This policy enhancement could effectuate (a) a broader accountability system for both academic performance and social-emotional growth, and (b) a standard system of care for child mental_health with schools as the focal point.

baseline: Implications for mental_health professionals intervening in the relatively flexible ASD period are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for dedicated mental_health professionals intervening in the critically sensitive ASD period are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for mental_health professionals intervening in the moderately flexible ASD period are discussed.

baseline: Results demonstrate the importance of addressing the sociopolitical context of resettlement to promote the mental_health of refugees and suggest a culturally appropriate, and replicable model for doing so.
high_intensity: Results urgently demonstrate the critical importance of addressing the challenging sociopolitical context of resettlement to fiercely promote the mental_health of refugees and suggest a culturally significant, and innovative model for doing so.
low_intensity: Results demonstrate the mild importance of addressing the sociopolitical context of resettlement to gently promote the mental_health of refugees and suggest a culturally appropriate, and simple model for doing so.
